name: places/ChIJ7_Ho0-H1wokRjeNx5Tzb29o
adrFormatAddress: 2322 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10035-1304, USA

originalText.text: If possible, avoid this place like the plague!!! Disrespectful and completely lazy staff. They will make you wait for hours and then have you come back to the same for days. They also do not process your recertification and then pretend not to have received it in the first place. Vindictive, malicious, and petty little liars work here. And, they refuse service to clients as well. I wouldn't be surprised if somebody created an active shooter situation here due to the actions of these disrespectful staff members. The Supervisor needs to be fired as he is completely lacking in competency!!! A Very Bad Place With TERRIBLE Customer Service.

originalText.text:
Hi! I just want to take a minute and THANK Ms. Galloway for making my trip to the center , on 126th street, a comfortable experience.  My Mom has dementia and I had to go down and submit her recertification documents.  I was nervous that I may do the wrong thing.  Ms. Galloway noticed my tension and guided me trough the process.  She was an angel sent from Heaven.  THANK YOU MS. GALLOWAY FOR YOUR PROFESSIONALISM AND ATTENTION.  YOU ARE THE BEST.  GOD BLESS YOU.
Sincerely,
Juan Paredes

originalText.text: The worst experience of my life. Watch out for a Ms. savory…more like miss unsavory … this woman is a perfect example of what is wrong with this office and the system as a whole. She will smile to your face as she tries to make your process as difficult as possible without ever wiping that sadistic grin off her face. If you ask her a question, she will defend the systems inconsistencies and literally tell you to leave if you point out the gaps in logic. I am horrified by the treatment my mother received at her hands and will do what I can to make sure she is held accountable. In the meanwhile, if you can avoid this office — and miss unsavory — you should do so at allll costs.

originalText.text: These people treat those in need as 2nd class citizens. Your needs are not their concern in the slightest and they make sure you know it from the beginning. If you call this number you'll get no answers to your questions because you'll get no answer at all. Some of them will tell you to handle your business online so they don't have to deal with you. Then when your case or paperwork gets lost they'll tell you "well you should've come into the office." A system designed to help 5/100 people a day and keep the other 95 coming back is a broken system and it only ensures that you stay desperate for a handout from them. Upon walking into the building you'll be given a number like a slave a herded into one room after another with extensive wait times in between. When you come across a lazy worker they'll make you believe they can't (see: won't) do anything for you. The worst kind of devils... Ones that masquerade as angels.
